00453 inline
00454 test_root::test_root() 
00455     : m_verbose(false) 
00456     , m_stop_on_failure(false)
00457     , m_reverse_mode(false)
00458     , m_error_count(0)
00459 {
00460 }
00461 
00462 inline
00463 test_root::~test_root()
00464 {
00465     if (std::uncaught_exception())
00466     {
00467         increase_error_count();
00468     }
00469         
00470     if (error_count() > 0)
00471     {
00472         std::cout
00473             << "\nTest driver failed: " 
00474             << error_count() << (error_count() == 1 ? " error" : " errors") 
00475             << std::endl;
00476     }
00477     else if (verbose())
00478     {
00479         std::cout << "\nTest driver succeeded." << std::endl;
00480     }
00481 }
00482 
00483 inline
00484 bool test_root::verbose() const
00485 {
00486     return m_verbose;    
00487 }
00488 
00489 inline
00490 void test_root::verbose(bool flag) 
00491 {
00492     m_verbose = flag;
00493 }
00494

00496 bool test_root::stop_on_failure() const
00497 {
00498     return m_stop_on_failure;    
00499 }

00503 {
00504     m_stop_on_failure = flag;
00505 }

00520 int test_root::error_count() const 
00521 {
00522     return m_error_count;
00523 }
00524 
00525 inline
00526 bool test_root::error() const
00527 {
00528     return m_error_count > 0;    
00529 }
00530 
00531 inline
00532 int test_root::return_status() const
00533 {
00534     return m_error_count == 0 ? EXIT_SUCCESS : EXIT_FAILURE;    
00535 }

00556     return m_test_name;
00557 }
00558 
00559 inline
00560 void
00561 test_root::increase_error_count()
00562 {
00563     ++m_error_count;
00564 }
00565 
00566 inline
00567 void
00568 test_root::decrease_error_count()
00569 {
00570     if (m_error_count > 0)
00571     {
00572          --m_error_count;
00573     }
00574 }
00575 
00576 inline
00577 void test_root::test_assert(
00578     bool condition, const std::string& test_case_name, 
00579     const char *msg, const char* filename, int line_number)
00580 {
00581     if (condition == reverse_mode())
00582     {
00583         std::cout
00584             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
00585             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
00586             << msg << " failed." << std::endl;
00587                 
00588         increase_error_count();
00589         
00590         if (stop_on_failure())
00591         {
00592             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
00593             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
00594             // test_root::exception_handler.
00595 
00596             decrease_error_count();
00597             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
00598         }
00599     }
00600 }
00601 
00602 inline
00603 test_root::suite 
00604 test_root::do_get_suite(const test_root::suite& available_tests, 
00605                       int argc, char* argv[])
00606 {
00607     TCLAP::CmdLine cmd("-verbose turns on extra trace for those "
00608                        "tests that have made use of it.\n"
00609                        "-assert_fatal is used to make the first "
00610                        "test failure fatal.\n"
00611                        "-help produces this help.\n"
00612                        "-reverse reverses the sense of test assertions.\n"
00613                        "It is  only used to test the test framework itself.\n"
00614                        "Any number of test names may be supplied on the "
00615                        "command line. "
00616                        "If the name 'all' is included then all tests will "
00617                        "be run."
00618                        "", ' ', "1.0", false); 
00619     TCLAP::SwitchArg verbose_arg("v", "verbose", "-v[erbose]", false); 
00620     TCLAP::SwitchArg assert_fatal_arg("a", "assert_fatal", "-a[ssert_fatal]", false); 
00621     TCLAP::SwitchArg reverse_arg("r", "reverse", "-r[everse]", false); 
00622     TCLAP::SwitchArg help_arg("h", "help", "-h[elp]", false); 
00623     TCLAP::UnlabeledMultiArg<std::string> test_names("testNames", "test names", false, "testNameString", cmd);
00624 
00625     cmd.add(verbose_arg);
00626     cmd.add(assert_fatal_arg);
00627     cmd.add(reverse_arg);
00628     cmd.add(help_arg);
00629     cmd.parse(argc, argv);
00630 
00631     verbose(verbose_arg.getValue());
00632     stop_on_failure(assert_fatal_arg.getValue());
00633     reverse_mode(reverse_arg.getValue());
00634     suite result = test_names.getValue();
00635 
00636     const bool includeAll =  
00637         std::find(result.begin(), result.end(), "all") != result.end();
00638 
00639     if (result.size() == 0 || includeAll)
00640     {
00641         result = available_tests;
00642     }
00643 
00644     if (help_arg.getValue())
00645     {
00646         cmd.getOutput()->usage(cmd);
00647         std::cout << "Supported test names are:" << std::endl;
00648         for (suite::const_iterator it = available_tests.begin(); 
00649              it != available_tests.end(); ++it)
00650         {
00651             std::cout << "    " << *it << std::endl;
00652         }
00653         exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00654     }
00655 
00656     return result;
00657 }
00658 
00659 inline
00660 int test_root::exception_handler()
00661 {
00662     try
00663     {
00664         throw;
00665     }
00666     catch (std::exception& e)
00667     {
00668         std::cout << "Error: " << e.what() << std::endl;        
00669     }
00670     catch (...)
00671     {
00672         std::cout << "Error: " << "unknown exception" << std::endl;
00673     }    
00674     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00675 }
00676 
00677 inline
00678 std::string test_root::underline(const std::string& title, char c)
00679 {
00680     std::string result;
00681     for (size_t i = 0; i != title.size(); ++i)
00682         result += c;        
00683     return result;
00684 }
00685 
00686 // The fructose double comparison routines are the same apart from
00687 // the name of the double_compare function actually called and
00688 // the string ("==", "!=" etc) in the diagnostic message.
00689 // Hence we generate the inline function definition using the
00690 // macros below. Note that we have two macros; one for the comparison
00691 // with specific tolerances stated, the other without.
00692 
00693 #define generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(comparison_function, \
00694                                                 comparison_name) \
00695 inline \
00696 void test_root::test_assert_double_##comparison_function(double lhs, \
00697                                    double rhs, \
00698                                    const std::string& test_case_name, \
00699                                    const char* lhs_name, \
00700                                    const char* rhs_name,\
00701                                    const char* filename, int line_number) \
00702 { \
00703     bool is_compared = double_compare::comparison_function(lhs, rhs);\
00704     if (is_compared == reverse_mode()) \
00705     { \
00706         char number1[22]; \
00707         char number2[22]; \
00708         snprintf(number1, sizeof(number1), "%21.15e", lhs); \
00709         snprintf(number2, sizeof(number2), "%21.15e", rhs); \
00710         std::cout \
00711             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in "  \
00712             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " \
00713             << lhs_name << " " comparison_name " " << rhs_name \
00714             << " (" << number1 << " " comparison_name " " << number2 << ")" \
00715             << " failed floating point compare." << std::endl; \
00716         increase_error_count(); \
00717         if (stop_on_failure()) \
00718         { \
00719             decrease_error_count(); \
00720             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed"); \
00721         } \
00722     } \
00723 }
00724 
00725 #define generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(comparison_function, \
00726                                                 comparison_name) \
00727 inline \
00728 void test_root::test_assert_double_##comparison_function(double lhs, \
00729                                    double rhs, \
00730                                    double relative_tolerance, \
00731                                    double absolute_tolerance, \
00732                                    const std::string& test_case_name, \
00733                                    const char* lhs_name, \
00734                                    const char* rhs_name,\
00735                                    const char* filename, int line_number) \
00736 { \
00737     bool is_compared = double_compare::comparison_function(lhs, rhs, \
00738                             relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance); \
00739     if (is_compared == reverse_mode()) \
00740     { \
00741         char number1[22]; \
00742         char number2[22]; \
00743         snprintf(number1, sizeof(number1), "%21.15e", lhs); \
00744         snprintf(number2, sizeof(number2), "%21.15e", rhs); \
00745         std::cout \
00746             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in "  \
00747             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " \
00748             << lhs_name << " " comparison_name " " << rhs_name \
00749             << " (" << number1 << " " comparison_name " " << number2 << ")" \
00750             << " failed floating point compare." << std::endl; \
00751         increase_error_count(); \
00752         if (stop_on_failure()) \
00753         { \
00754             decrease_error_count(); \
00755             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed"); \
00756         } \
00757     } \
00758 }
00759 
00760 // Generate the code for all the inline comparison function definitions.
00761 
00762 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(eq, "==")
00763 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(ne, "!=")
00764 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(lt, "<")
00765 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(le, "<=")
00766 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(gt, ">")
00767 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(ge, ">=")
00768 
00769 // same again but this time with the tolerances specified.
00770 
00771 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(eq, "==")
00772 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(ne, "!=")
00773 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(lt, "<")
00774 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(le, "<=")
00775 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(gt, ">")
00776 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(ge, ">=")
00777 
00778 template <typename lhs_type, typename rhs_type>
00779 inline
00780 void test_root::test_assert_eq(const lhs_type& lhs, const rhs_type& rhs,
00781                                    const std::string& test_case_name, 
00782                                    const char *msg1, const char* msg2,
00783                                    const char* filename, int line_number)
00784 {
00785     if ((lhs == rhs) == reverse_mode())
00786     {
00787         std::cout
00788             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
00789             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
00790             << msg1 << " == " << msg2
00791             << " (" << lhs << " == " << rhs << ")"
00792             << " failed." << std::endl;
00793                 
00794         increase_error_count();
00795         if (stop_on_failure())
00796         {
00797             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
00798             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
00799             // test_root::exception_handler.
00800 
00801             decrease_error_count();
00802             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
00803         }
00804     }
00805 }
00806

00809 #define fructose_assert(X) { fructose::test_root::test_assert((X), \
00810                              get_test_name(),  #X, __FILE__, __LINE__);}
00811

00815            fructose::test_root::test_assert_eq((X), (Y), \
00816            get_test_name(),  #X, #Y, __FILE__, __LINE__);}
00817 
00818 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_EQ(X,Y) fructose_assert_eq(X,Y)

00908            fructose::test_root::test_assert_double_gt((X), (Y), \
00909                  relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance, \
00910            get_test_name(),  #X, #Y, __FILE__, __LINE__);}
00911 
00912 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_DOUBLE_GT_REL_ABS(X,Y, \
00913            relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance) \
00914     fructose_assert_double_gt_rel_abs(X,Y, \
00915            relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance)
00916

00918            relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance){\
00919            fructose::test_root::test_assert_double_ge((X), (Y), \
00920                  relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance, \
00921            get_test_name(),  #X, #Y, __FILE__, __LINE__);}

00926            relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance)

00932 #define fructose_loop_assert(I,X) { \
00933     if ((X) == reverse_mode()) \
00934     { std::cout << #I << ": " << I << "\n"; \
00935                        fructose::test_root::test_assert(reverse_mode(), \
00936                        get_test_name(),  #X, __FILE__, __LINE__); }}

00996 #define fructose_assert_exception(X, E) \
00997     {                                \
00998         std::string report;          \
00999         bool ok = false;             \
01000         bool caught = false;         \
01001         try                          \
01002         {                            \
01003             X;                       \
01004         }                            \
01005         catch(E&)                    \
01006         {                            \
01007             ok = true;               \
01008             caught = true;           \
01009         }                            \
01010         catch(std::exception & e)    \
01011         {                            \
01012             std::ostringstream ostr; \
01013             ostr << e.what();        \
01014             report = "exception caught as std::exception: "; \
01015             report += ostr.str();     \
01016             caught = true;           \
01017         }                            \
01018         catch(...)                   \
01019         {                            \
01020             caught = true;           \
01021             report = "caught in catchall"; \
01022         }                            \
01023         if (!ok)             \
01024         {                    \
01025             if (caught)      \
01026             {                \
01027    std::cout << "exception caught but not of expected type" << std::endl; \
01028    if (report.length() > 0) \
01029    { \
01030        std::cout <<  report << std::endl; \
01031    } \
01032             }                \
01033             else             \
01034             {                \
01035    std::cout << "expected an exception to be thrown but catchall caught nothing" << std::endl; \
01036             }                \
01037         }                    \
01038         fructose::test_root::test_assert(ok, get_test_name(),  #X " throws " #E, __FILE__, __LINE__);} 
01039 
01040 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_EXCEPTION(X, E) fructose_assert_exception(X, E)
01041 
01042 #define fructose_assert_no_exception(X) {      \
01043         bool no_exception_thrown = true; \
01044         try {X;}                         \
01045         catch(std::exception& e)         \
01046         {                                \
01047             no_exception_thrown = false; \
01048 std::cout << "Error: An exception was thrown where none expected. " \
01049 << "Exception is: " << e.what() << std::endl; \
01050             fructose_assert(no_exception_thrown)  \
01051         }                                \
01052         catch(...)                       \
01053         {                                \
01054             no_exception_thrown = false; \
01055             fructose_assert(no_exception_thrown)  \
01056         }}
01057 
01058 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_NO_EXCEPTION(X) fructose_assert_no_exception(X)
01059 
01060 #endif
